intro: Commersonia procumbens, commonly known as the prostrate commersonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand dry conditions. It is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
